event.title: was opened to non-Indian settlers in response to public demand on September 16, 1893

data.event: Grant County was part of the Cherokee Nation's Cherokee Outlet until it was opened to non-Indian settlers in response to public demand on September 16, 1893.
Settlers named the county after President Ulysses S. Grant in a general election held November 6, 1894.
Medford became the county seat through an election held on May 27, 1908.

event.title: built a railroad from northern Kansas through Grant County in 1889

data.event: The Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway (later the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railway) built a railroad from northern Kansas through Grant County in 1889 and 1890.
